When we told her the wine was way off she acted like she figured it had gone bad, we kind of looked at each other in surprise at the table. I hate to speculate beyond that because I really loved the meal and casual atmosphere but if you get some less than yummy wine, do us all a favor and vanish it to a land far far awayyyy!!

We came for Easter Brunch the food didn't come out at the same time although it was good. Our server Dawn was not very friendly and abandoned us after she dropped off the check. We wanted dessert but couldn't get anyone else to wait on us.

Amber was great..  we sat at the bar and the food was wonderful we brought a few friends everyone here is very cool... funniest part was when I came in I ask the host do I have dog hair on my shirt... and she brought out a lint brush.... what service...

Disappointing.  I expected better from a small chain that made good pizza and chopped salads in their other incarnation.  It was not good from the beginning and went downhill from there.  The crab shrimp dip was ok but lacked flavor.  The pita given with it was just plain burnt on the bottom.  The kids angel hair pasta was clumpy and overcooked and the qlwagyu burger was impossible to eat as the bun was soggy and fell apart, the lettuce was bigger than the bun and the onions were not fully caramelized. The burger itself tasted good and that was all I ate. For desert we had the mini donuts. Again these were burnt so badly you could see the black spots.  The sauce was good.  I will say the service was great though and saved this review from being 1 star.

Tonight I had the grilled mahi tacos - yum!!! Delicious, grilled perfect and the chipotle sauce was way good!!! We come here often and the lobster bisque is another favorite along with the grilled veggie salad and duck tacos.  I also like the chicken lettuce wraps!

Came in on a Saturday for lunch, the place was packed! what a beautiful setting, I felt like I was back in California. Very open and windows everywhere!
Sat at the bar, with the bartender Mary. Wow what a sweetie. She was truly on her game. 
My bf and I split a few apps. We had the hummus and duck tacos. Mary even had the chef prepare slices of the gluten free crust so I would have something other then veggies to dip. And the duck tacos, I could eat these everyday they are so good.
Grilled duck, with cilantro, tomatoes, fetta and some type of cilantro sauce. Theyre amazing.
We will def be coming back here soon.

I've been here a handful of times and it's always consistent.  Inside is beautifully decorated and duck tacos are always yummy.  Feta cheese, lettuce, tomatoes and the tender duck.  How can you go wrong.  The Vietnamese crab stack is delicious as well.  Ask for extra bread and u can enjoy as a full meal.  Sliders are great... moist and juicy.  

Go during happy hour and appetizers are half price.

I love Sammy's. This Green Valley location is beautiful and always clean.  Service is always spot on. I have ordered the Grilled Shrimp Salad for years. It's my favorite. I can always count on it always being made the same and perfect. My mother's last birthday was at Sam's a few years back.  She passed away 3 months later. The picture of the Giant mountain of Cotten Candy is such a great memory to have. My grandkids love the kids menu pizza and of course The Messy Sundae is a favorite. Love, love, love Sammy's.

We've lived in this neighborhood for two years and never even tried Sammy's.  It just looked like a local, quick gambling joint.  We were wrong.  We've now been there twice, and both times it was very good.  The first time we had the satay and calamari appetizers.  The chicken satay was cooked beautifully and was tender, but the best part of it was the peanut sauce.  We liked it so much we ordered a container of it to bring home.  The calamari was different than we've ever had.  It was more of a calamari meatball than regular fried calamari.  It was seasoned well and cooked well.  I really liked it, but my wife did not like the texture.  The second time we had the Asian appetizer which included potstickers, satay, and grilled shrimp, and they were all superb.  We also had the Thai salad and the NY pizza.  The chicken on the salad was tender and very good.  The pizza had great taste and was cooked evenly on the bottom, which is better than 99% of the other wood fired pizza places.  We also had one of the best servers we ever had.  Her name was Jess.  She was cheerful, prompt, and had great follow-up even though the restaurant was full and she was very busy.  She saw we hadn't received our food yet and checked on it without our asking.  We appreciated that she didn't give us a personal sob story to increase our tip.  We will certainly go back to Sammy's again.

We stopped in at lunch to try the $10 power lunch special.

Arrived about 11:45am, and we were seated right away. Sammy's is spacious, lots of tables, a large bar and it looked like banquet type rooms off the the side.

Our server was amazing. Friendly, fast and accurate, exactly what you need at lunch time if your on a time limit.

For my $10, I got a personal Pizza and a Greek salad. Both were great tasting, and it was plenty of food for the price.

We will be back again.

I have been eating at this place for years with my friends and family locally and from out of town.. this is my GO TOO place! Never had a bad experience. Their food just gets better and better every time I'm there, which I didn't know was possible.. LOVE this place, must try if you've never before! :)

This is my favorite restaurant. I enjoy their food every time, always yummy and reasonable prices keep me coming back for more. Try the duck tacos when you're there, awesome! The staff are always friendly and have smiles all the time.

Bullshit!!!! This is the last that I ordered a delivery. I waited more than hour and half. I received a cold pizza. If you want to receive a cold pizza to your home this is the perfect place. The manager was an asshole on the phone

2nd time here in the last month. The food has nice flavors but the pizzas are a little light on toppings. I ordered a Hawaiian, it only had 1 piece of ham & 2 pieces of pineapple per slice that is not much for a $13 pie. The service is also quite lacking
Great place to have food and drinks, staff is friendly and service is fast. We've been there several times and will continue to go back. Try it out Vegas

I used to be a fan of Sammy's for years but as time as passed my tastes buds have matured. When I heard a new location opened closer to home, i decided to check them out. 

The place is huge and elegant, especially the bar area its perfect for happy hour.
La Dou's Barbecue Chicken pizza is fantastic, nice balance of sweet and savory.
I also got the Spicy Italian Sausage, it was okay I thought lacked flavor.

Overall it was an okay experience, hasn't changed much since the last time i went.
I'm glad it's still around it brings back good memories.

Stopped by here with the wife on Sunday evening.  Had the duck mini-tacos, sausage pizza and five cheese pizza with chicken and the flourless chocolate cake for desert.  The only thing holding this back from a 5 star rating was that the server did not pay us much attention, he was busy setting places on other tables and carrying stuff from one station to another.  Make no mistake though, everything coming out of that kitchen is delicious!
We loved having Amanda L! She put the hockey game on for me and gave us a completely private table. Dinner came out perfect for all of us and everything was delicious!

Sammy's wood fire Pizza is one of my Favorite restaurants for Salads. They make the best Chicken chopped Salad. It's out of this world. With that said all there food is really Good. I can't say enough about the place. For the ones that have never tried it please do you will be going back as a regular. 
Brian

Really cool place. I went in right before brunch ended and I ordered the happy hour brunch breakfast tacos. These were delicious! Also tried the crispy fries which were equally as yummy. I will definitely be back for more brunch specials. Service was also on point.

Food is okay. I got the Thai chicken salad and it had too much mint in it which was unpleasant. Bartender Travis is awesome. Hostesses sucked (seemed clueless and did not adequately tend to waiting customers), and the waitress was a little kooky (not in a good way). Restaurant was way too cold to be pleasant.

Highly recommend. The restaurant is very clean, beautiful ambience, friendly staff, lower weight times no matter what time you go. Beautiful view, amazing food no matter what you order. I recommend trying the duck tacos, the chopped Asian chicken salad, the cheese breadsticks, the tropical tea and order the steak that you cook on the rock. The kids will love that. All-around great place and reasonably priced. Plenty of parking.

I had a great experience here, Marcus was our bartender. So friendly and nice to talk to. My shrimp salad was awesome large and delicious I ate every piece of it. I was recommended here by one of my guest at Kings fish house and I'm very happy I came. I heard they have a great happy hour. Bar stools where very comfy. :-) Mike next door was very friendly too.

I've been here a few times and have tried a few items on the menu and it's always just okay. I've tried their pizzas, salads, desserts, variety of appetizers, and I've never had anything that really impressed me. The kobe beef sliders is usually what I go for when I come here because they are probably the best thing on the menu. The last time I went here they had a lot of new items and I was pretty excited about them. I tried the empanadas from the appetizers. Being Argentinian, I was interested in seeing what their interpretation of an empanada would be. Sadly, they were not very good. They were definitely not your traditional empanada. It seemed like they were frozen and heated up in a microwave. Needless to say, I won't be ordering them again. The service here is fantastic though, so I kind of wish their food matched the service. 

A few tips: 
If you want bread, you will have to ask for it. They don't provide it to you otherwise. 
The salads here are huge, even for sharing. I would recommend getting the individual sized salad, even if you are sharing it.
If you have the option, ask the hostess to seat you on the right side of the restaurant. This is where they have huge windows that brings in a lot of natural lighting.

Waited a few minutes to be seated, and that pattern continued throughout the meal.  Waited for drink order, waited for food order and waited  for drink refills( my personal hot button issue). The pizza was good, but had to enjoy it without a drink.  Food was good, but poor service distracted from the experience.
neighborhood gaming tavern

Went to dinner tonight, Jules was our server and she was awesome.

The food is normally awesome however one item we ordered was the Oak Roasted Asparagus.  Usually a very good dish, tonight for some reason it had a bad taste.

The Hot Rock was great as always, the humus plate and truffle fries were good as well.

For dinner everyone had something different from the Oak Roasted Chicken to the Flat Iron Steak, pepperoni pizza, pasta and cheeseburger.  All were good.

The service did seem a little slower then normal however as I said Jules was a great server and took the time to share some jokes with us.  She definitely made the evening and had a great personality.

I recommend this place and if you get Jules, she has a great personality as I just said so have some fun with her.  It makes her job and your meal more enjoyable.

I recently came to Sammy's with a group of gals for a lunch meeting. It was a Sunday and the place was pretty dead, maybe only 2-3 other tables had people. The location is a short drive away from the 215 and in front of some office buildings. 

For my meal I went with the Thin Crust Brie & Truffle pizza. They were offering both brunch options and lunch, but pizza just sounded right to me. The timing of our entrees was a little slow, maybe about 10 minutes from the first plate being received to the last. That was a bit disappointing, but the food was great. My pizza was hot & fresh. I loved the cracker thin crust and it had plenty of cheese. 

I'm sure I'll be back at Sammy's again in the future. I'd like to try to come for a dinner next time for a little more liveliness.

Looking for a nice place for lunch on a Saturday (or any other day), Sammy's is a great choice!  They have a good assortment to choose from - pizza, soups, salads, pastas, a good assortment of finger foods and deserts.  They also have a kids menu.

This location is always clean and the staff is always friendly and courteous.  There is plenty of parking behind he building.

We started off with garlic cheese bread.  Like a cheese and garlic pizza without the sauce.

An Asian sampler - skewers of grilled shrimp, a couple pot stickers with dipping sauce, and a couple skewers of satay chicken in a peanut sauce.

Followed by a mozzarella cheese and pepperoni pizza.

Ended with a Messy Sunday!

We were lucky enough to get Raychelle as our server, so was had a great time!  Definitely a place to go back again and again!

Food is great, but the service is terrible. Waited for 15 minutes for any wait staff to come to our table after being seated at 3:45pm--not crowded. Husbands food came out at least 5 min after my daughter and I got ours. No one checked on us until 10 minutes after we finished our food. Annoying!

I absolutely love the location and vibe of this place. I sat at the bar on the restaurant side and I believe our bar tender was Caitlin. She was very personable and tentative. We had some of the happy hour appetizers, which were delicious. I will definitely be going back.

I went here 3 days in a row after my first experience because I absolutely loved the location. The open windows allowed airflow and direct sunlight which made my experience even better. (I'm all about that direct sunlight and breeze) it reminded me of a restaurant you'd eat off the beach in Hawaii or California. 

Definitely try the Mini Kobe Beef Burger with both cheeses and ask for extra Chipotle Aioli sauce on the side for the fries. Tasted so delicious.

We went for brunch and were extremely disappointed. The food was awful and the service was bad. We definitely won't be coming back when there are so many great brunch options in town. I'd give this one star, but they had a fairly nice garden, so I'm giving it two.

My wife and I just had the most amazing salads at Sammy's..Awesome service, Ashley and Jenna, were so sweet and amazing!!!  Thanks for the great service and great food!!!  Keep up the great work, see ya soon!!!

Early dinner, late lunch maybe. Had the fettuccini Alfredo. Good flavor, sauce was nice and thick, been here before but didn't check in, had the wood fired pizza and it didn't disappoint. I recomemd Sammy's for a casual dinner maybe early lunch. Good service

Went here on Wednesday and was happy to find out they have wine Wednesdays. Half off all bottles! I was in the mood for some small plate options and this had some interesting things on the menu. My husband and I started with three which would have been enough but decide to squeeze in one more.
Duck Tacos-Great sauce but meat could have had more flavor.

Meditarnian dipping plate-Terrific! Fresh pitas, great hummus and the cheese and sesame so very good.

Pork dumplings - decent with a little crunch which was nice.

Coconut shrimp with orange/horshradish dipping sauce-Amazing! The best thing we had. They should bottle that sauce.

Over all the atmosphere was very nice with comfortable seating, dim lights. Our server was terrific (I think her name was Adriana?). Service was quick, attentive and our wine was very good.

The only reasons it didn't get 5 stars was:
A) The host was slow greeting us at the door. It would have been nice if the servers or bartenders at least greeted us as they past and let us know someone was coming soon.
B) It was just a little pricey for the food. Not too bad, just a little over what it should be I think.

We will be back on Wednesdays for sure!

The worst take out I've ever had. The $10.00 Caesar salads were little dinner salads with super oily Caesar dressing. Kids couldn't eat it, they'll eat anything. My spaghetti and meatballs were okay, but there wasn't very much.. The bread they sent was so little, it was for two people not 4. I didn't get to eat dinner because I gave my spaghetti and meatballs to my kids. You could tell the person who put it together doesn't care at all. Oh and the chicken for the salads was over cooked so bad it was blackened to much to eat. Just crazy and I like Sammy's. I've been to green valley location many times and always enjoyed it. Take out from green valley was such that I'll never order take out again.
This place is amazing!  Great food, and the staff is incredible!!!  Mandy is hands down the best bartender ever!!  Highly recommend to all!!!

Great to finally have a restaurant/bar move into this long vacant space in my hood!
Was treated to lunch for donating a backpack to CCSD. Kudos for having this charity event!
The space is quite impressive, with an atrium main dining area and earthy/modern decor.
The crab stack appetizer was good with an elegant plating. The lamb chops were a little overcooked but had good flavor, and were served with tasty white beans.  The flourless chocolate cake was pretty amazing, and I'm not a chocolate dessert fan.
Sammy's is off to a good start in Green Valley!

Christy makes a refreshing Peartini and Garret makes a yummy raspberry martini. The restaurant is a clean, local place we like to swing by regularly. We get 10% off drinks and food for being LifeTime members. Oh, and I love the floating balls

I love the selection, great salads and very earthy feel. Perfect for casual night out or working lunch or dinner with their outlets for use in a few booths. 

Very open neighborly feel.

We went for an event the other night and WOW best food in town, seriously!!! They serve 4 dif salads all FABULOUS, 4 did piazzas 'to die for' & 4 dif pastas all Fantastic, my fav was angle hair pasta with Tomatoe sauce, I'm going back SOON!! Y'all should go TODAY!!!

I went here because I was invited as part of a networking group.  We had the wine tasting dinner, and Clos du Bois was the sponsor.

The food was decent and I liked the wine pairings.  I just felt the chicken was a little dry and same with the beef.  I don't know if it's because of the wine pairing dinner that the food was that way; maybe they were mass producing things since it was busy.  I find chicken breast dry in nature, but this one was particularly dry.

Service was very good though, I must say!

I liked the atmosphere (I would probably love it if I were single....nice bar!) and might be back if I'm in Henderson, which is rare.

Nice spot for brunch or dinner. Open design with a bar in the center. Front half of the restaurant has glass sliding door walls whic they ope. When the weather  is nice. Pretty good service and tasty food. Love the Sticky Toffee Pudding dessert!

Went basic today. Its a cold wet day so I had the tomato basil soup and a caesar.
Both were okay hard to mess up soup and salad.
Waitress was very funny.

omg the sliders y'all .. go there for the sliders alone they are truly little hamburgers made of real, fresh meat (if they aren't fooled me) grilled to perfection on little fresh buns with ketsup and a pickle omg they are real good this place surprised me it's hidden behind trees etc. on wigwam and GV parkway but find it .. go there ... great food :)

The worst service possible and if you love everything drenched in olive oil please order anything cause there is no shortage there! Waitress cared less for the plates stacking on my table! Thanks for allowing me the opportunity to never wanna come back and recommend the same for anyone who reads this or I know!

I like the employees, management is horrible. Owner get a clue! This guy must only know low end pizza, Sammy this is a bust and I blame you. I've gone to many Sammys, he must just be to old to get it, retire and save ur business. This place is horrible top to bottom.  If the owners name isint Sammy, whoever you are quit. I will never spend a quarter in this place again.

What a disappointment. Have been here multiple times and really expected much more. Had family in town and really bragged up this place. We called ahead and requested a reservation for 6 at 6pm. Table was ready as promised. Seating was not good. They had us in a large round table half sofa seating. My guests had to use pillows to try and elevate them to the table. Very uncomfortable. 
My son ordered the lobster mac and cheese. It came out in a small bowl, nothing at all special. He swore up and down that it was either artificial lobster or maybe even imitation crab  meat. Very small portion, meat was not very good.
Mom ordered duck tacos. Has had them many times before. Evidently the chefs are being pressured to watch food costs. There was nothing more than a tiny sliver of duck meat on each tack. Very chincey. The service was lousy. We had to ask multiple times for dishes to be removed from the table, drinks to be refilled. 
We are not alcohol drinkers. OUr total bill with tip was $170 for 6 of us. Not one person was blown away by their meal. All of us were disappointed in the quality of food. Very disappointing.

We decided to go here one day after work because we had seen it pervious day and wanted to try it. Boy am i glad we stopped in and tried them. We got the asparagus scramble, loved it. It's a new twist and some everyday, i couldn't get enough. For being not a huge fan of asparagus i couldn't get enough. But thats not the best part. Their french toast with filling and orange was amazing. Ill definitely be going back for it. The manager, and waiter were very kind. Thank you for making a long day end amazing. We'll be back soon..

I hosted a birthday party at Sammy's last October and the manager and staff could not have been better.  They were attentive, kind, and helpful in every way.  I wish I could remember the manager's name because she really was the best.  Because of the excellent service and good food, I will always go back.

I definitely enjoyed sitting inside this restaurant during my lunch break from work. I love all of the windows and natural light that brightens up the dining area. Even though it was chilly due to the AC, I loved how clean and modern the restaurant is now. I also heard that when it is nice outside they open up the sliding doors which would be wonderful!

I went to Sammy's for a work lunch break. One friend got the BBQ woodfired pizza, another got the Kobe burger, another person got the sliders, someone who has come to Sammy's often got the duck tacos, and I got the Balsamic Chicken Salad that was gluten free friendly. 

My salad was way overdressed. Painfully overdressed to be honest. The chicken was a little dry too. However, it was still a little enjoyable, but I was sad I didn't get the shrimp salad or the Kobe Beef Chili which were also gluten free friendly. 

My buddy said the duck tacos are always good, never too greasy, and he ate them all! One of the best things on the menu! The BBQ pizza looked good, supposedly tasted pretty good, but not going to lie, he said he has had better pizza nearby. It was a nice portion though and smelled delicious!

The sliders got a thumbs up, but he said to go with truffle fries since the basic fries are just that. Basic. The Kobe burger was delicious (per my fellow employee) and juicy. Good sized portions without being obnoxious. 

Overall, the experience was good. I won't be running back to come here immediately, but I will come back to try other items on the menu. One of the guys in our party say he's never been disappointed, so I'll give it another go! Plenty of gluten free and vegetarian options which is great! 

I'd say worth a try!

Excellent service, waiter was great. Nice new clean vibe from place, gaming area in back is recommended. Had wagyu burger and fries with lobster mac and cheese. Burger was a bit undercooked so it fell apart, otherwise better than most average burgers. Friends were above average as well, seasoned with steak seasoning.  Lobster mac and cheese was cooked and seasoned well. Would recommend this place for a quick tasty lunch with great service and atmosphere.
Delicious food, beautiful atmosphere and very friendly staff. I will definitely be back. Also they have a great lunch special, 2 for $10. Two thumbs up!

Does not disappoint !!!
Sammy's is a great place to chill with my family , 
My kids always destroy The place and the staff is always nice ! 
Especially Albert !!
He rocks great service

Terrible service!!! We were celebrating Father's Day with the family. There were 2 open booths, so we asked for a booth & the hostess said she just sat people there & stuck us on a table between 2 large parties. The waiter came by 10 minutes after we were seated & apologized for his delay & took our drink & food order & left. We noticed that no one ever sat at those booths & now there were 2 more booths available so we asked again for a booth & were sat at a booth. Twenty minutes later our food came & was on its way back to the kitchen since our original table was empty & they thought we left the restaurant. We flagged them down & complained to the manager that our drinks were still not out. She made a face & said she'll check on it. The food was good & the waiter added a free dessert but disappeared again & after waiting for 15 minutes for him to pick up our payment, I walked over to the kitchen and handed him my credit card. Worst Service Ever in a restaurant which was mildly busy.
I called the restaurant 25 minutes later & was extremely disappointed AGAIN...

Horrible Customer Service! We left the restaurant angry because of the terrible service on Father's Day & forgot our left over to go bag on the table. Less than 30 minutes later I called the restaurant & the hostess tells me they tossed the bag because no one ever comes back for pick up after they leave the place. 
We eat out a lot as a family & these guys have the worst customer practices of anything I've experienced so far in Henderson, Nevada.

The reason why I give this place 5 stars is because our server was amazing. She was very sweet, nice, and understanding. Not only was she checking in on us frequently, she even gave the best suggestions for the food as well. We got the meatballs, tomato basil soup, and the New York pizza. Her name was Naz, I believe, very kinda and beautiful! I will go here again and again if you continue to have people just like her! Thank you again Naz!!

I am enjoying some apps and beer here on happy hour. Lobster Mac&Cheese so good. Good atmosphere friendly staff, Marcus our bartender making drink after drink with a Xmas party here yep he's doing a great job.

This place always has great food. Never fails. From bottomless mimosas to a casual beer and pizza night, this place has a friendly neighborhood vibe. There may be some wait staff that have a short attitude; let's be honest, it isn't easy serving in this town. Markus, the Monday through Friday bartender is truly genuine and probably helps makes the

. He knows his drinks. It would be nice to see the menu change with the season. One last thought... Beware of the shishito peppers; although mild at times (still cooked to perfection) you may get a plate of hot ones! Luckily the amazing peanut based dipping sauce is close at hand to help relieve the mouth. On a side note, the sauce served with the shishito peppers is amazing for dipping their calamari, and pretty much any other vegetable.

I've been here a few times over the years and despite one poor experience, this place is great!  The food is always on point, the decor is chic and inviting, the staff is attentive, and it is close to me which is always a plus!  This time in particular I had the Chinese Chicken Salad and it was fantastic!  I will definitely be furrowing my brow the next time I'm here as I decide what to order besides this.  Possibly the Thai Chicken salad, a pizza, some pasta??  I want to try it all!

Nice environment, friendly staff. We came here for a company luncheon bc we heard the pizzas were to die for. Well that's partially true, I almost died when I took my first bite...I think little Caesars pizza is better,  and I hate little Caesars.  I'm sure other things on the menu are good, but that pizza ruined my taste to come back

I am so excited to have this fabulous restaurant so close to my home. The food here is so good, and I plan on eating here a lot! I love love the salads, especially the shrimp salad, I could eat it daily! The pizzas are wonderful, the crab stack appetizer, chicken lettuce cups, literally everything is delicious. This is destined to be one of my favorite places!

A new Sammy's Restaurant in Henderson, relocated, remodeled and revamped!

The biggest difference is the location, though. The old Sammy's was hidden away on Sunset Rd, very hard to find. This new spot on Green Valley Pkwy is much more convenient and visible! 

Opening the menu, it looked familiar with the original items, plus a few new additions (or have I just overlooked them?) 

Vietnamese Crab Stack was refreshing, light, and very tasty. Presented so elegantly, my whole table enjoyed it. 

Off the happy hour menu, the Kobe Sliders had rave reviews from my boyfriend & his parents.

I've also enjoyed:
Mediterranean Dip Sampler
Hummus
Oak Roasted Asparagus
Lobster Mac & Cheese
Wok'd Sesame Shishito Peppers
Grilled Shrimp Salad
Salted Caramel Pudding

The food overall is pretty darn good. From their huge salad portions, unique tapas, Brie/truffle oil pizza w/ mushrooms (my favorite Sammy's pizza), or the ginormous Messy Sundae's overflowing goblet, there's many great dishes for every palate and appetite. Plus I ALWAYS appreciate any establishment that offers and labels vegan, vegetarian, and gluten-free options!

For me the best thing about this Sammy's is the interior set-up. I LOVE their patio area, where you can sit in plushy comfortable couches(with pillows!) which are part of their booths and look out the surrounding windows. It makes it airy, spacious, and welcoming. I can see me eating lunch there frequently if I worked nearby.

The prices are still pretty high, I always thought that. If ordering tapas, it's a shame if you don't go during happy hour, when selected items are half off. 

Service has been a hit or miss here. It seems the first visits, the staff were still getting used to their new operation, so their timeliness was off. It's gotten better though, our last dinner with our parents was awesome! We'll be come back to try their brunch...

This place is the worst if you want fast service. We been there 3 times and 3 times the service was super slow the first time we had to ask for a awaited and end up the manager took our order and took forever to get ketchup and mustard for our burgers.second time we had to wait again for a waiter to come around. Third time we wait about 5-7mins to be seated and left so if u want extra slow service go here we won't be back!

Today was my daughters high school graduation and decided to have her celebration at this Sammy's since it's only a block away from my house. My husband and I have dined here often and knew it would be a good place to have a small gathering for the graduation dinner and I was so happy we did. 
Thank goodness for the manager Erin, she was very helpful in planning our menu, then when I can hang the graduation decorations, she volunteered to do it for me and everything else. She was a God send!!!
After the graduation we arrived for the gathering and the private room looked amazing and she already had salads, bread and waters all on the table. Plus she decorated the room and looked great. 
Then the food started to come out so delicious and the waitress we had, she was great too. The overall experience was fantastic!
Thank you Erin for making the celebration so seamless!

We used to love Sammy's but as of tonight we will no longer be dining there. I was asked to leave because my 3 year old was crying, no louder then music and ambient noise. We saw exactly who complained and it was not multiple people. I was not in anyway ignoring my child nor did I have any disregard for the other patrons.

I do need to recant my review above.... Paras the regional manager and the GM have since made contact and we have resolved what had happen. To everyone reading this, everyone has different parenting styles and from the outside you do not know their situation. Please do not judge a book by its cover.

I can't say enough good things about this place!  Every time I come, the food is tasty, the ambiance is excellent, and most of all the service is top-notch!!  It's one of the few places that I frequent alone because it is THAT good. Try the duck tacos and alllll of the pizzas!

It's been years since I've been to Sammy's and Joel had never been so when he won a $25 gift certificate we decided to check it out for lunch. 

I enjoyed the atmosphere. It was very calming with all the light woods and fake water tanks. Our server was very prompt and brought us our drinks. I really loved the menu. I'd go back just for the tapas. They all sounded very yummy. We picked the Duck tacos to start with and I got the Shrimp pasta and Joel got the New York style pizza. Wow! The Duck tacos! Yuuuuummmmy! I could have just eaten like 20 of these little bite size tacos. You do get 6 tacos ( I was forced to share with Joel. Hehe) they are filled with grilled duck, a creamy avocado and cilantro sour cream, queso fresco, and bits of tomato and fresh cilantro. Really! What a treat that was. My Shrimp pasta was also so yummy! (I love that I had the choice of whole wheat pasta.) My dish contained huge shrimp, zucchini, artichoke hearts, mushrooms, and it was all mixed with a light and creamy lobster sauce. I was in heaven! The $19 it cost was so totally worth every penny! Joel's pizza had mushrooms, pepperoni, salami, and Italian sausage with a red sauce. The sauce was full of flavor and Joel loved all the meat that was on it. 

Other then our waitress not noticing the gift certificate and charging our card full price it was a great experience. ( she felt really bad that she messed up) The decor is great, the atmosphere relaxing and the food was on point. It is a bit pricey, but with the level of food they have it's justified. Can't wait to go back and try more of their tapas.

I hosted a birthday brunch for 16 people yesterday (Saturday), and the food, drink, staff, and management were all excellent.  They allowed me to build a menu myself and printed off a copy for each guest with pictures of entrees but no prices.  Manager Paras and Assistant manager Tia responded to my email questions promptly and helped my daughters set up centerpieces, providing them with a small table for a powerpoint presentation and a cupcake stand.  The food  arrived for all 16 of us at the same time and was still hot.  Everyone said his/her selection was excellent, from the grilled asparagus omelet to the eggs benedict to the lemon and fresh blueberry pancakes.  Our server Jess checked in on us frequently and refilled coffees and mimosas several times.  I was worried because the restaurant does not have a separate banquet room, but for most of the 3 hours we were there, only a few other tables were occupied.  They did not rush us at all.  Thank you all for making my celebration top notch.
Amanda L was a great server! Made our Mother's Day dinner special. We were unexpectedly given a private table and she put the hockey game on per request. Thank you!

Went on June 16 to Sammy's Restaurant and Bar on Green Valley Parkway in Henderson, NV and met a friend I had no seen in 20+ years.  Oh my gosh, the staff were awesome.  They did not intrude on our conversations and no one rushed us about anything.   At about 9:00 pm we stopped talking long enough to notice that the restaurant was 99.9% empty and apologized profusely to our server and others working there.  This was met with a

.   We split hummus (beyond yummy), a spicy Italian Sausage Pizza (delicious) and a Caesar Salad (oh so good).  Needless to say, way to much food for the two of us.  Had enough for lunch the next day.  It has a little something for everyone and a full bar, which I always enjoy.  I have never been disappointed at Sammy's.  It's lively, very, very clean and easy to get to.
I absolutely love this place...the bartenders rock and the food is superb! I would recommend this place to anyone in the GV area.
fork it off the skewer
hostage

Ive been here about 5 times, the service has always been good.....but the duck tacos are AMAZING! I wasnt going to get them today but my husband ordered them, so of course I had to eat one. Every time I eat them its like its my first, mmmmmmmm my gosh how can they be so delicious and exploding with flavors, the crunch of the shell filled with duck, feta, tomato, cabbage and a yogurt sauce? Holy sweet heaven. Pizza is always good. My husband loves the mini burgers.

I have now dined at this Sammy's location 7 times now and each time it gets a little better.  Considering that I live about 3 minutes away, it is very pleasing to have another close by dining option.

I have enjoyed breakfast 3 times and dinner 4 times at this location.  I probably would have given it 5 stars if it had a slightly better selection on the menu...but of course YMMV depending on what you like.  

All of my breakfasts there were very good, but a little expensive.  Dinners were also very good and a good value.  I've enjoyed pasta dishes, pizza and dinner salads...and would not hesitate to reorder any of them again.

One thing I do note is that this Sammy's is WAY better than the other Green Valley location that is now closed.  That one had me completely turned off to the place and I planned on never going back.

One other notable thing is that the environment is very appealing here, especially when they open up the sliding glass walls when the weather is nice.

My wife and I are regulars at Sammy's, we love the place. Great food and a fabulous bar. Garret is fantastic my favorite bar tender. A great place for an after work drink and meal. Give them a try you'll be glad you did.
Roy H.

The service was horrible.  Ordered two pizzas and a salad. 35 minutes for the pizzas to arrive, they were room temperature.  The salad took another 25 minutes. Server was non-existent.  Had to ask other servers for drinks and our check.  Disappointing. Will not be back.

TWO STARS is all you get. Reason being I am glad this location was not taken over by a pawn shop, happy ending spa or a needle exchange and also because the food is decent. I repeat. The food is decent. 

My big beef with this restaurant is the service. When I say service I mean the Management. 

I have been to Sammy's on three separate occasions. First time with a fellow Yelper for brunch and I had the breakfast tacos which were good. Not great, but good. Service was on point.

Second visit was at lunch time on a Sunday with my mother. It took our waitress 25 minutes to get us our drinks. I realize how long it takes to get water and how difficult it is. What was even more annoying than our waitress was the fact that they let the patrons who were sitting at the nice bar in the center of the restaurant scream at the TV during the football game. They were tossing back $10 bottomless Mimosas and obnoxiously reacting to every play and startling all of the dining customers who most of them appeared to have just come from church. Not cool especially because this restaurant has a side sports bar where they should have been directed to. Not cool especially because the Managers did nothing at all about it. The Managers stood by the bar and watched the game the entire time, too! Not my idea for a relaxing Sunday brunch. If I wanted this ruckus I would have gone to the sports book!

Third visit I really disliked a pasta dish I was sharing. Took one bite and no more. I mentioned it to the waitress and was still charged for it. Way to keep it classy, Sammy's. 

NOT ONCE IN ANY OF MY VISITS DID THE MANAGERS TOUCH ANY TABLES TO SEE IF THE GUESTS WERE HAPPY WITH THEIR FOOD AND SERVICE.

Lastly, I did not want to write this review.It's my favorite time of year when I pretty much love everyone and everything.  I shared my frustration with their website directly. But, when 2 MONTHS later I did not receive anything more than a generated email response from the Sammy's website I knew I had to let the Yelp family know. I will not be playing it again, Sam I am.
Alexxx is awesome! Literally the only reason I come here after work with my co workers! Always a good time with him behind the bar!

The food is sooo yummy with lots of great choices! Raychelle was our server and she was amazing!! Sooo friendly and attentive. The atmosphere is chill and comfortable. This is definitely a place to enjoy with your friends, family or just by yourself  we will for sure be back!

Three of us went there. Pizza was pretty good. Salad was good. Two of us ordered alcoholic beverages. We all requested water. The waiter brought us a carafe of water that had no ice. The water was warm. It tasted like it was unfiltered water right out of a garden hose. Undrinkable. If this is their attempt to force restaurant-goers to all order a drink, then I'm not falling for it. I hope I never go there again.

Great food, great service! A must try if your around Green Valley Parkway and Pebble area. Bbq Gouda chicken pizza and toffee pudding was delish!! The hot stone steak appetizer is also a must try. They brew a really refreshing passion iced tea as well.

We live pretty close to Sammy's and have eaten here a few times before, but it has been a few years.

This is what we ordered:

Mini Duck Tacos-I was very surprised I liked this dish! The duck was crispy but tender. Loved the flavors of the cilantro and feta added with it. It was a perfect appetizer. 

Spicy Thai Grilled Chicken Salad-very delicious, but it wasn't spicy at all. I loved the fresh herbs and the perfectly grilled chicken. Just a little too many peanuts added. 

Sicilian Pizza-So good! I can't believe I never ordered a pizza here before. The crust was perfectly soft and crunchy. Normally I don't eat the crust because it's either too crispy or flavorless without the sauce and cheese but this dough was delicious. I also loved their sauce. It was so fresh with a touch of spice.

This is my closest neighborhood poker bar and I'm giving it another try. 
My latest visit was at the bar in the gaming area and I had the shrimp/crab dip & the red quinoa salad (from the regular menu). I was pleased that the bartender gave me both the happy hour menu and the regular menu WITHOUT MY HAVING TO ASK for the happy hour menu! Kudos.
I was impressed with how cozy the bar area is. The white lights around the bar really make the place comfy. The bar chairs, not so much. 
Back to the food- the shrimp/crab dip was disappointing. If you're gonna feature crab, I better be able to taste it! Not so much here. It was served hot and with plenty of flatbread but the flavor just wasn't there. The salad was excellent and very fresh. Loved the beets & avacado, 
Would have again for sure and maybe try some tapas from the happy hour menu next time.
They have gaming promos such as earn 250 points on Mondays get $20 play next visit.

Guaranteed great service. Staff is always fun and personable. The Greek salad is to die for! The messy sundae will put you in sugar coma. The atmosphere alone is open and cozy with great natural lighting.

Just had appetizers and the ahi poke, duck tacos and the chicken lettuce wrap were all fantastic!!  Great Hawaiian flavors, intentional or not, was spot on!!  Will be back!!

Ambiance was surprisingly bright, lots of windows, may try out their brunch!
i'm sorry this is taking so long
what I can get for you sir
Sammy's is a great place to spend happy hour and quick early dinners. Food is always consistent and the ambiance is good.

I wish I could give ZERO stars for my experience at sammy's today. I frequent this location at minimum once a week and I have never received such poor service as I did today. The lack of consideration I received while dining with my black friends was remenisant of Jim Crowe laws. I attempted to address a major concern to the manager opening the huge patio doors in front of my table to accommodate another guest when the   temperature outside was 62° and our party was literally freezing, only to be addressed in such a condescending manner by the assistant manager TAMERA. This was blatant discrimination and I will never bring any guest here again!!

Well anything that replaces an Applebee's is already a plus in my book. I like Sammy's Pizza, it's usually convenient when I meeting my friends who live across town or meeting friends with kids, as I find them very kid friendly. I've visited the Arroyo Crossing & the W. Sahara location multiple times and it is never a disappointment. I love their Pear & Gorgonzola pizza along with the others, BBQ, Margarita. My favorite app is the Duck Tacos (not to be confused with the duck quesadilla, not a fan). And who doesn't love the Messy Sundae? 

This location is great, huge open floor plan, bar right in the middle, but my favorite thing about this location is the wall facing Green Valley Pkwy opens up and exposes the entire restaurant to fresh air. I love it! This is definitely a great addition to the GV area. Can't wait to come and try brunch. This place is pretty decent when it comes to chain restaurants.

Weren't sure what to expect but the interior was nicer than we had anticipated. My husband and I are currently on a keto diet (zero carbs) and the kind waitress accommodated easily. 

Tuna poke to start without wontons it was delicious. 

My husband had the Greek salad and she warned the dressing may have a pinch of sugar so we switched it out. 

I had the wagyu burger with a lettuce bun. Wasn't asked how I wanted it cooked but it was delicious. 

Overall our waitress was extremely attentive and friendly. It was  very busy when we arrived but slowed down a bit near the end. We would come back.

Why in the hell is the chicken burnt tasting on the Chinese chicken salad? And the wonton noodles almost burnt as well?  It would have been probably a good salad if everything didn't taste burnt.  It was a company lunch but this is all bad.  Then when I asked to bring it back because the chicken was burnt and salad tasted bitter they were cool about it and told me it would be ready in 10 minutes....I get there and the
only wanted to replace chicken only!  Nevertheless, the waitress was Pissy because I had eaten a small portion of the salad

? I got a replacement salad and when I got back to the office I got a totally different salad and wasn't what the company paid for....they are not worth the damn trouble to patronize this business again.
Lauren is the best bartender possible. Her sass and wit are unmeasured and her cocktails are delicious. Will be visiting basically all the time.

My friend Sarah Jane invited me to the Sammy's elite event as her plus 1, but when she wasn't able to make it. She somehow got me invited with a plus 1 to the Sammy's VIP event a few nights later. I love that girl!

This was a complete success from start to finish. They executed this event perfectly. I was greeted at the door and she easily found my name. My friend wasn't there yet, so she wrote her name next to mine and assured me she would have no issues getting in. 

As I walked in I was greeted by more people, one offered me a glass of champagne. I went to the bar and almost immediately someone came up to me to offer a slice of pizza. The flow of the food was perfectly timed. It seemed just as I would finish one thing someone else was offering me a new item. Pretty much every thing I tried was delicious. The pizzas were great. My two absolute favorites were the Goat Cheese (Sautéed mushrooms, garlic spinach and red onion - which I took off) and Five Cheese (Gouda, Raclette, Romano, Mozzarella, and Gorgonzola - perfect). The Garlic chicken was my least favorite, although I did like the BBQ Chicken (Smoked Gouda, BBQ Sauce, Cilantro - I removed the ren onion, of course)

The duck tacos were great. I really liked the tomato/cilantro sauce. Duck is definitely one of my most under eaten but favorite meats. I love when a restaurant isn't afraid to use it. They also had a duck quesadilla that was pretty delicious. I was in duck heaven. 

Some other yummy things that I tried: Some kind of tuna on a cracker - perfect and some kind of fish tacos. Both were good, but I really liked the tuna. The specialty cracker (it didn't really taste like a regular cracker) paired perfectly with the tuna. I could have eaten 100 of those. So good!!

One of the only things I didn't like too much was the hummus. I'm not sure exactly what about it. Maybe I was just stuffed as it was one of the last things I tried, but I think I just didn't like it. 

Even the house red wine they were serving was pretty good. I tried a few of the specialty cocktails and although they were good. I'm not a cocktail girl.

Everyone was so friendly. Great customer service. We sat at the bar the majority of the night and even though the staff seemed very busy they were attentive. The venue is awesome. Large bar right in the middle. There's an atrium style room to one side with large windows. There's also going to be a tavern open 24/7 linked to the restaurant. 

I can't wait to come back on Thursday for ladies night. Ladies drink 2 for 1 8pm to 12am and also to try the mac and cheese, made with Tillamook Cheddar, my favorite!

Sammy's is a great place to go with friends or family coming into town or just for a nice night out. It is on the pricier side but worth It. Their food is high quality and very flavorful! Definitely recommend their salads. So yummy

Nice people, good food, convenient to work and home. I dine here frequently, and have had no complaints so far. I almost had a complaint earlier because of some child screaming. I understand it's hard to raise infants/toddlers, but it's also common decency to try to comfort the kid without being a nuance to other patrons. Not this parent. This mom decided to ignore the screaming and totally disregard the other people trying to dine at the establishment. I was about to make a complaint, but apparently somebody beat me to it. The parent was asked to take the screaming kid outside, and the parent threw a fit. Immediately I saw where the child gets their mannerisms from, as the mom proceeded to cuss out and berate the employee that kindly asked them to step out. Mind you, the employee didn't tell her to leave and never come back, she kindly asked her to take her son outside momentarily to calm him down. Nothing rude about the employee, extremely rude of the mom. I'll continue to come here, as they genuinely care for the convenience of all patrons.
Pizza was so tasteless and bland. Worst pizza I've ever had. BBQ chicken not spicy like usual. I won't go back there's too many good pizza places.
Is This Love,

This is a great place to go to during happy hour. Even though the prices aren't THAT bad, it's just 10x better when paying the happy hour price!  One time at another location, we called and ordered and the let us dine-in while putting our order in with happy hour specials. That's awesome customer service!  The duck tacos are like nothing I've ever had before!  They are truly unique and definitely a must-try!  They are served mini on a bed of sour cream. They also have a tangy cream sauce inside. The coconut shrimp appetizer is also deliciousness!

I went here for dinner tonight. The food was very good. But the staff did not seem knowledgeable. I'm in the restaurant industry. I have always worked where you need to know the menu. I ordered a glass of reisling and the server asked if it was red or white! I asked about the Greek yogurt on the menu she didn't know it was there. Upon leaving I asked the manager about it and he didn't know about it either. It still says 24 hours on website and menu but it's not! I will be back for the food. I just won't ask any questions. Get it together!

The Wagyu Cheeseburger is awesome and the Messy Sundae is a must. Service is great and they have an excellent cocktail menu. I definitely recommend this place after being here multiple times. It has become a new favorite.

Honestly, a restaurant is as good as it's staff and it's food.  Sammy's on Green Valley Parkway hits the mark on every criteria!  I have been going there for .... well, since it opened at this location.  Over the years I've gotten to know the whole staff and it's like Cheers, you know?

Erin has gathered an epic staff that make the place run like well-oiled machinery.  You can tell the employees enjoy working there and they always make me feel welcome.  The menu is varied enough that you never get bored and all the items are well prepared and of the highest quality.  Behind the bar we have Chris, Aubrey, Caitlyn, Jenna and Brandon who are always super friendly and efficient.  Between the management staff Erin has Ashley and Justia taking care of all the details and while effortlessly making it all happen, they never forget that it SHOULD BE FUN!!  And it is, and that's why we always go back again and again.  Great staff, excellent food, convenient location.  Thanks for having us.  We appreciate your amazing service and food.  Thank You!!
Just found out that they don't serve breakfast anymore... ugh. What a let down! It was sooo good the first time. Wish they'd bring it back.

My friend and I had an awesome dinner at Sammy's! The food and the service were both awesome.

We were greeted and seated as soon as we walked in. Both my friend and I are pretty challenged when it comes to making menu decisions. Sammy's has so many awesome menu options it can make it even harder to decide. However our waiter was super helpful and patient with us. 

We ended up getting the poke and hot rock steak appetizer, the burratta and heirloom tomato salad, tequila lime chicken fettuccine, pear and prosciutto pizza and lastly the sticky toffee pudding dessert. Every dish was delicious! Definitely can't wait to come back!

The restaurant is good but the 24 hour bar is my favorite hangout. Jamie the bartender is personable  and always upbeat. He remembers what you drink when you come back. Definitely a locals gem. The food is good. Machines are a bit tight but we go back because of Jamie.

I came here on a Friday night with my family. I called ahead and they said it would be about 35min. We got there early and got seated on time. However, they need a better way or space for people waiting for a table. 

The ambience was very nice (Californian). Cozy.

The menu was very diverse with still the staple of Sammy's (pizzas). Boys got pizza and burger, thumbs up. Asian salad was okay. Shrimp and grits good, but have to grab some chorizo and grits for flavor. Salmon with edamame was horrible. Their idea of flavor is to layer soy sauce on the bottom of the plate. No! Deducted Star.

Service was okay. Waitress didn't seem to have a good day maybe?   Overall, service just seemed off from the time you come in the restaurant to the end of service. Deducted star.

I would go back to give it another try.

Had been to the other Sammy's on 215/Flamingo and the one on Rainbow in Arroyo Crossing Shopping Center. Both were good experiences BUT this place was drastically different. Upon walking in, place looks unkept and unorganized. We were seated and basically just sat there for 15 minutes and no one came over nor even bothered to address us that they would be right with us. There was some clueless blonde lady walking around(who appeared to be the manager) but did not really seem to notice her staff were just meandering about aimlessly. We walked out and went to Elephant Bar down the street.
Horrible experience with the staff! I work in this area and I refuse to come back here. There are other reataurants within the vicinity with far better food quality AND excellent staff.

Horrible. Do not go!  Food was horrible. Service sucked!  Waited 15 min to get seated with the restaurant being empty. They had three hostess and they were all confused. Then seated and ordered and when out food came everything was cold. I don't go to restaurants to get served cold food. After I told them they did apologize and comp our meal but just disappointing for a family Sunday dinner

Our Sunday brunch at Sammy's  was easily one of my favorite dining experiences that I have had in a while.
I can't believe I have not experienced this spot sooner. I LOVED how many vegetarian and vegan options they offered. This restaurant is so accommodating with dietary restrictions. **bonus points**
Everything was absolutely fabulous. The food, the service, and the vibes. 
I would love to start the review by mentioning how beautiful the restaurant is. It's so airy and bright, surrounded with glass doors that have nothing but beautiful greenery all around the outside. My husband even made a comment that he thought it was a great spot to start bringing clients. I felt as if I was at a resort type restaurant. Such a beautiful beautiful space! 
The service was fantastic. Ricardo waited on us and he was so helpful, friendly, full of suggestions, and incredibly attentive. I loved how well he knew the menu and how willing he was to guide us through it as we made our selection. 
THE FOOD! My favorite favorite part! 
My husband ordered the chicken wings while I started with the hummus sampler platter. My husband loved the wings and platter was divine. I will get it every time I visit Sammy's from here on out! 
We followed our small plates with a Greek salad. YALL. Sammy's does Greek salad right! It was piled high, tossed in the most scrumptious dressing, with an abundance of veggies and feta cheese. I can easily say they have the most impressive Greek salad I've ever seen and tasted. SO DELICIOUS.

We finished our salad and moved on to pizzas. 
Once we took our first bite, we immediately knew we had found our new favorite pizza spot! The crust was so unbelievably perfect. The exact way we love our pizza. Not too doughy, the perfect amount of crisp, and ohhhhh the magnificent sauce. 
We ordered the bbq chicken pizza and the Tuscan. 
I don't eat meat, but I can assure you I know it was good just by watching my husband savor each and every bite. 
I do have to say, I believe the Tuscan was the show stopper. Topped with Roma tomato's, mushrooms, red onion, and Gorgonzola It made for the most unbelievably delicious pizza. In fact, I've been planning my trip back just so I can indulge in the delicious delicious wood fired Tuscan pizza. 

We finished with the flourless chocolate cake which was a deliciously decadent way to end our dining experience. I'm so happy we were informed of Sammy's incredible happy hour with 1/2 off small plates! We WILL be back. Again and again. 

PRO TIP: order the espresso martini! It's a divine secret menu cocktail!
The staff is awesome! The gaming is loose 24 hrs! Great Happy Hour and brunch on the weekends.  Not to mention the fireball is always cold.

I have been to this location twice.  The first time our service was poor, tonight it was worse.  It's a shame for such a nice location / atmosphere.  Our waiter was extremely poor.  Service was slow or not at all.  The restaurant had a nice crowd, but not busy.  With the amount of other restaurants in the local area, I can't recommend this place.

The experience was great from start to end!
Only one minor issue. Chicken was a little burnt for my liking. Beautiful open air dining! Must try!

This restaurant is a great staple in our family's favorite places to dine. Friendly staff, quick service, and consistently good food. Variety of options on the kids menu and delicious gluten free crust for those who want/new that option. My husband's favorite topping is their Italian sausage.
crazy

Dawn was our server, very friendly, checked back with us to make sure the food was satisfactory and find out if we needed anything. Cocktails were very happy! Food was fabulous! We had the Kobe beef sliders, duck tacos, arugula pear pizza, mozerella cheese pizza, and Thai chicken pizza. So good! Restaurant was clean, atmosphere was great. We have also come for breakfast, had marscapone French toast, and a Brie omelette. Both fabulous as well. The staff, kitchen, and dining room are on point.

Well came in today with my girlfriend for the first time had their New York pizza with their own ingredients with chicken wings very good plate on both would recommend their pizza and chicken wings to anybody we will return.
The worst chips I ever had in any restaurant. I Ordered Sammy's chips and Guacamole, cost 10 bucks. they serve u the grocery bag chips! Cold and salty. So disappointing.

Absolutely fabulous!! Brought the family in because they have never been here and they loved it!! Food was amazing as always but Jules, our server, really made the experience. She Had a great sense of humor and was very attentive. Ask for her if you go in because she is awesome!!
Great Happy Hour Friday night - Marcus was really fun and knew his stuff at the bar.

Really enjoyed Happy Hour: Roasted Brussels Sprouts, Baba Ganoush, Roasted Cauliflower and wonderful Malbec. Rachel and Chris gave outstanding service at the bar! Definitely recommend....will frequent considerably more often. ;-)
Place is pretty big. There is 4 sections (24hr gaming bar, indoor, regular bar and a
artisan crust
our

We visited sammys on Sunday brunch. Honestly I wasn't aware they had brunch so that was a nice surprise. We opted out of ordering off the brunch menu but it did look really good. I ordered a personal pizza , I don't eat cheese so I ordered a Sicilian without the cheese and onion. I very much enjoyed the pizza. It had lots of pepperoni, sausage, peppers and sans onion. The crust was chewy and crispy at the same time. The whole pizza in general was crispy. I'm assuming because I had no cheese. The bf pizza was a little soggy but still great flavor. The server picked up on the fact I don't dairy and was kind enough to let me know the sauce has cheese so she was able to switch it to marinara. Great service, great food, giant beers. Awesome!

I was pleasantly surprised at how nice this place is! The restaurant's exterior is kind of plain but once you walk in you see right away that this is a fabulous place to meet friends or business colleagues for a nice meal or a drink. Check out their happy hour daily!! Very good service and great food too!
The Tequila Chicken is amazing!  They also have 2 happy hours each day with great appetizer deals.
Dropped in here (aka
I gotta message all my BFFs and tell 'em right now,
Had salad and Thai spicy pizza split it with wife. Excellent both service and food was great. Ice tea for me always there with refills and wife had merlot $10.50 but potent.

We had heard great things about Sammy's so we thought we would give it a go. We were greeted and sat promptly. Very crowded and had families around which made it a little loud for intimate conversation. I ordered a Lobster mac and cheese for a tapas appetizer, was not as impressed as the reviews posted said I would be. I did see a lot of them ordered. If it was half of the price it was offered at I would have been okay with it. taste wise it was good, had lumps of crab meet and a good amount of cheese. I ordered a pizza The New York Style. I thought New York style would at least be cooked through. The crust was crunchy but the middle was under cooked and doughy. not impressed. Not sure what specialty is here since their menu is all over the place. Josie had the Grilled Hawaiian Mahi Tacos. These were fresh and spicy, maybe too spicy for the spouse. I had some and I thought her choice for dinner out did mine. Overall it was nice, they were attentive which is a must. May or may not go here again. Can say to try it your experience may out way mine.

This place was okay. It was my only off-strip dining the last time I was in Vegas, and I just ordered a bunch of shareables (sorry...English spelling): ahi pokes, edamame, curried cauliflower, mahi mahi tacos, baba ganoush, and so on. It was good. The service was very attentive. It's in a business park and isn't the kind of place I would usually go, but I was meeting a group and for that it was perfect.
If you're gluten free, the menu is ripe with options. The service has been wonderful. Timely and attentive. They, also, accept reservations. The meals are on average $12 for dinner. I will be back.
Great local gaming bar. Friendly bartenders. I would recommend better signage on the back entrance to the gaming bar and two more TVs behind the bar. Otherwise a gray place to watch a game.
young, loud kids
The Hot Rock

Although the food was good, I hate to say that the service this time around was not. My first time here a few weeks back was much better, even though the place was packed, we received constant, excellent service. Tonight was a totally different experience. We ordered an app and two pizzas, waited at least thirty-five minutes, app never showed. When the pizzas arrived we asked that the app be cancelled. Our server came back to say the pizzas just cooked faster than our little dumpling app (really??). I can forgive a mistake (like if someone forgets to put our app order in...) but I don't like being lied to. She proceeded to say that it was being cooked and that the manager would swing by and 'take care of it'. We never saw such manager, our server only checked on us once, and I left with a bad taste in my mouth. I love the feel of this new Sammy's but one cannot live on ambiance alone. There's a small mom & pop pizza spot down the street from home that always delivers on the service front. I'd rather give them my business no matter how meager it may seem. It would have showed some good character if a manager would've showed up and simply apologized for whatever mistake was made. No need to comp anything, just own up to the mistake, apologize and move on. Very disappointed, I really wanted to love this new location.

This was our second time eating here and the service was awful. Took an hour to get any food, which was simultaneously the appetizer and an entree for me (not what I ordered, surprise!) then brought my wife's cold food 10 minutes later. Cold salmon is not good. Waitress didn't seem to mind at all. The one good thing she did was take the salmon off our bill. After paying we went to get food somewhere else. Too bad because our first trip was great.
it's different
exit
gluten-free
box
box
we don't give out boxes
will this do
i will probably only ever serve you once
Ok so this is my first time here.. so I had mini duck tacos for appt...and pasta for main .. everything is best to + .

A good friend recommended I try Sammy's for a casual business lunch.  First impression was of a pleasant decor and intriguing menu. But my salad was awful.  They appeared to be understaffed by at least one server as we waited and waited for iced tea refills, which finally came with no ice so we drank warm tea.  I didn't plan on going back, but my wife wanted to see if we might have a better experience my second time.  We did.  She really liked the sliders and I ordered a different salad (the balsamic chicken) which was quite good.  Still seemed to be understaffed though.  One more quality waiter would really improve the timing of their service.

We had always heard that Sammy's food was so good and couldn't wait to try it.  So on Friday night, we placed an order to go.

We ordered a 5 cheese pizza and were completely disappointed.  I should have known that it wasn't going to be good as when I picked up the box, I had to check to see that there was a pizza in there as it was so light.  The pizza tasted like something you'd get at Cici's or a low chain buffet.  Completely disappointed.

We also ordered the Balsamic Grilled Chicken Salad and this was ok.  The chicken was a bit burnt and dry.

We also ordered some Pork Dumplings and they were probably the best thing we ordered.

As for the service, there was some confusion on how to pay for a to-go order when I went to pick it up . . . they were nice enough about it, but just seemed like they still haven't gotten the flow of a new restaurant yet.

I looked at the other reviews and just didn't have the same experience as others had.  Maybe it was an off night . . . maybe the food doesn't hold up when you take it to go.  Maybe we need to dine in and see what we think before completely writing off this restaurant. 

I do know this . . . . If I want to order Pizza to go, I would much rather get it from Metro Pizza.  Hands down!!!

Did I stumble into Summerlin? Holy cow this place is all kinds of sexy and very modern. Wayyyyy different then the older Sammy's. Sammy's got it's groove on. The wife and I meandered in Wednesday for some happy hour and grub. The place was humping and I was really impressed by the space. It had a welcoming, yet cool hip vibe. They were doing a wine dinner that night so we ate at the bar to avoid a wait. The service was good and the food was typical Sammy's; good price and great taste!

Our group comes here every month for about six months and Julia always waits on us. She remembers our drinks and orders. We get great service and we love the privacy of the back room. Great food and great service, you can't beat it!

We used to love coming here! But the service has gone down hill... Food prices have good up!! For a family dinner it's taken 1 hour just to get the food. 40 minutes to order!! And the order isn't even correct. How about writing the order down? 
Please Sammys hire more servers and/or train them better.

Ordered to go today and as usual, food was fantastic. I ordered a Chinese Chicken Salad and Wagyu Burger which both had great flavor and totally hit the spot. John greeted me on the phone and took my order. He and I spoke about different selections on the menu. I was surprised at not only how well he knew the menu, but how he was able to suggest items based on the menu items I was ordering. It was nice to talk to someone about the many different dishes. It would take forever to try them all! He was friendly, hospitable and very willing to take care his customers. So Thanks for your help today John! Keep up the great work, we will be back. If you haven't been to Sammy's you are definitely missing out!

OK, So we went back for dinner the other night and decided to sit in the dining area. Again, everything was wonderful. Food was great,my soulmates lamb chops, perfect. My fish tacos good but not great. Service  was excellent, and Garrett, the bartender, continued to pour us some really great  cocktails, including, as I say again, the BEST espresso martini I have ever enjoyed. This place is a keeper.....Try it. Ciao

This is my new favorite pizza spot. My boyfriend and I LOVE pizza. This location is small but but it's gorgeous inside. Our waitress Keialiana was amazing!! Very attentive, great personality! We will be coming here again.

Great food, Great service! Some must tries:
Hot Rock. So cool, you get to cook NY Strip how you like it on a hot rock.
Lobster Bisque. 
Spicy Italian Sausage Pizza. My Favorite!
Chinese Chicken Salad.
Spicy Chicken Angel Hair Pasta. Never disappoints.
Wagyu Cheeseburger.
Everything is great and the staff will make sure you have a great time!

I ate here last night for the first time and loved it! I got a grilled chicken and hummus wrap and it was so delicious.  A perfect blend of flavors!  The service was ok but far from good. The prices were very reasonable.  I will definitely go back for the food!

Middle of the week lunch with a friend and decided on Sammy's. Upon arrival, the restaurant was not busy for the day of the week. After a few minutes of socializing, we were waiting on our server, who looked as if she was consumed with more than she can handle. It took a little longer to get her attention and get in our food to meet the time requirement for the lunch menu special. My friend and I ordered a soup and each a subsequent dish. We both expected the soup to be out as our first course but instead, everything was brought out together. The server was very nice and polite but we felt that the service was a bit slow. The food was good and the atmosphere is awesome, the service, however can be little more refined.

Always a go to as we live nearby and the food and service is consistently great.
Have to send a shout out to our server Brandt D IV....he was amazing! Fast attentive service above and beyond!

Just got back. I had the grilled vegetable salad. It was small and didn't have enough dressing. The waitress didn't come back to see how everything was till we were done.  My friend had the grilled chicken. Nothing special. Kind if foo foo food. Not a big fan. Food was fair, service poor. Wont go back.

Very good option In Henderson!!
Nice place, good food. Not expensive. 
Lot of choices on menu for different tastes.

When Sammy's initially opened at this location, my husband, granddaughter and I decided to try it out.  It was very noisy which made it very difficult to have a conversation.  In addition, the food was lackluster - nothing special. We gave it another shot last weekend and came away very disappointed.  My husband ordered the chicken Caesar salad.  The dressing wasn't blended well and the chicken tasted like they microwaved it. I had the balsamic grilled chicken salad.  It tasted like soap. We complained to the manager about the Caesar salad.  His response was that no other customer complained about it all night and we were the only ones unhappy.  After this reaction, complaining about my salad was moot.  They took off the Caesar salad from our bill, but it did little to make up for such a bad experience.

I'm only giving a three star because i actually love this place.... normally. The low rating is strictly for a particular bartender. The brunette bartender with the east coast accent has terrible customer service skills. I was there for over an hour and only got one drink, i placed my empty drink on the bar rail in front of me (in front of the machine) and patiently waited for another one. Didn't get it. Wanted to eat... never got a menu. Never offered a menu. There were two gentlemen on the bar next to me by the juke box and they got the most service. They got spectacular service. And she spent quite a while taking with them... guess i wasn't her preferential guest. Fine. 
Then i had someone meet me... and when she came and ordered a drink.. the tonic was flat. After waiting 15 mins to see if the bartender would notice her guest not drinking... or asking if we needed anything (like a menu or players card... which we needed both) i finally told her about the drink. And waited patiently for it while she tried to figure out why another machine wouldn't work....  
I'm a bartender too. So i get when things happen.... but this was ridiculous. I just know now to never come in when she's working.
where is he???!

The food and service were good. Love the atmosphere! The outside sign has you thinking this is just like a bar food type of place with gaming but when you walk in you will be pleasantly surprised with the decor and service. Very nice menu options, a little pricey for lunch though.
Amazing place for a drinks, appetizers, food and bartenders!   Go enjoy this place is great may I suggest the duck tacos they are amazingly delicious!

I enjoyed Sammy's! Came here for dinner with some girl friends from work.

We ordered two (vegan) appetizers: 
-Brussels sprouts without cheese 
-Walnuts & olives

They were totally delicious-- especially the roasted Brussels sprouts with balsamic vinegar!

-Most Pizza crusts are vegan.
-the marinara is vegan, not pizza sauce--it has cheese.
-They have Daiya mozzarella cheese. 

I ordered a pizza with whole wheat crust, marinara, spinach, olives, onions, bell peppers, artichokes & sundried tomatoes. It was wonderful! (I would normally order the vegan cheese, but I am not a fan of Daiya)

The server was wonderful! Very knowledgeable and accommodating. 

I will be back!
Loved it when it first opened. Last couple of times it seems as though they either sold it or did a HUGE cost cutting. Portions are smaller. Bottomless mimosas were 90% orange juice. Not cool.
